p: LAMP assay is also helpful in detection of RNA template by combo use of reverse transcriptase along with DNA polymerase (Notomi et al. 2000; Whiting and Champoux 1998). Due to this, LAMP has already found wide application in RNA virus detection, such as foot-and-mouth disease (Dukes et al. 2006), swine vesicular disease (Blomstrom et al. 2008), Taura syndrome (Kiatpathomchai et al. 2007), severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (Hong et al. 2004), norovirus (Fukuda et al. 2006), human papilloma virus (Hagiwara et al. 2007), cytomegalovirus (Reddy et al. 2010), human immunodeficiency virus (Hosaka et al. 2009), and H5N1 avian influenza virus (Jayawardena et al. 2007).
